title.narrative: Provision of humanitarian air services and emergency telecommunication services to the humanitarian community in Yemen

description.narrative:
Following escalation of conflict, the lack of provision of air transport and logistics were identified in the Marib response plan as key limitations of effective response. Therefore, WFP UNHAS added a weekly connection to Marib to its routing to allow improved humanitarian access to the area. Part of the requirement to deliver the assistance is to continue the regular air service to Ma’rib and put in place the arrangements required to make the air strip operational. Necessary support requirements to conduct these flights include staff to manage UNHAS operational related tasks in Safer. CERF funds will be complemented by other donor funding to allow for the continuation of the service not only to Marib, but also in and out of the country to allow humanitarian to reach populations in need, in e.g. Marib and Al Jawf.
With the openings of the hubs/ETC sites in Mokha, Hajjah and Marib, the ETC supports the humanitarian response to vulnerable, conflict affected populations in the most difficult to reach areas. Following the escalation of conflict in Marib, ETC received additional requests such as assist with provision of solar power for the IT equipment in the Marib hub, appoint a dedicated IT staff for user support, set-up the UNDSS radio room. This allocation would support the connectivity contract to ensure connectivity in humanitarian hubs, as well as UNDSS radio rooms, vital to continue the humanitarian response in Yemen.
